tool.name: qiime2 metadata shuffle-groups
tool.description: Shuffle values in a categorical sample metadata column.

validator.message: The first column cannot be selected (they are IDs).

param.name: n_columns
param.label: n_columns: Int
param.help: [default: 3] The number of shuffled metadata columns to create.

param.name: md_column_name_prefix
param.label: md_column_name_prefix: Str
param.help: [default: 'shuffled.grouping.'] Prefix to use in naming the shuffled metadata columns.

param.name: md_column_values_prefix
param.label: md_column_values_prefix: Str
param.help: [default: 'fake.group.'] Prefix to use in naming the values in the shuffled metadata columns.

param.name: encode_sample_size
param.label: encode_sample_size: Bool
param.help: [default: No] If true, the sample size of each metadata group will be appended to the shuffled metadata column values.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: metadata shuffle-groups ================================ Shuffle values in a categorical sample metadata column.
Outputs: -------- :shuffled_groups.qza: Randomized metadata columns
|
Description: ------------ Create one or more categorical sample metadata columns by shuffling the values in an input metadata column. To avoid confusion, the column name and values will be derived from the provided prefixes. The number of different values (or groups), and the counts of each value, will match the input metadata column but the association of values with sample ids will be random. These data will be written to an artifact that can be used as sample metadata.
|
